# Issue 29233: bootstrap && make distclean broken

archive/issues_028996.json:
```json
{
    "body": "* #26964 now creates documentation files during bootstrap\n* make distclean blows away these generated files\n* subsequent make fails when building documentation\n\nThis ticket fixes it by deleting the generated files in `bootstrap-clean` instead of `misc-clean`.\n\n\nCC:  @dimpase @embray @jhpalmieri\n\nBranch/Commit: 0dc97dbb12fcde2981cc0a4ef4bbd4938b5e74dc\n\nReviewer: Dima Pasechnik\n\nAuthor: Matthias Koeppe\n\nResolution: fixed\n\nIssue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/29233\n\n",
    "closed_at": "2020-02-23T16:51:36Z",
    "created_at": "2020-02-22T16:03:32Z",
    "labels": [
        "component: build: configure",
        "blocker",
        "bug"

    "milestone": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/milestones/sage-9.1",
    "title": "bootstrap && make distclean broken",
    "type": "issue",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/29233",
    "user": "https://github.com/vbraun"

```
* #26964 now creates documentation files during bootstrap
* make distclean blows away these generated files
* subsequent make fails when building documentation

This ticket fixes it by deleting the generated files in `bootstrap-clean` instead of `misc-clean`.


CC:  @dimpase @embray @jhpalmieri

Branch/Commit: 0dc97dbb12fcde2981cc0a4ef4bbd4938b5e74dc

Reviewer: Dima Pasechnik

Author: Matthias Koeppe

Resolution: fixed

Issue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/29233

archive/issue_comments_437102.json:
```json
{
    "body": "<a id='comment:4'></a>Our `distclean` doesn't remove `./configure`, neither should it ihmo. Distclean should remove whatever configure output there is, but it should keep the actual configure script which would go into a proper tarball.",
    "created_at": "2020-02-22T18:13:18Z",
    "issue": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/29233",
    "type": "issue_comment",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/29233#issuecomment-437102",
    "user": "https://github.com/vbraun"
}
```

<a id='comment:4'></a>Our `distclean` doesn't remove `./configure`, neither should it ihmo. Distclean should remove whatever configure output there is, but it should keep the actual configure script which would go into a proper tarball.



---

archive/issue_comments_437104.json:
```json
{
    "body": "<a id='comment:6'></a>Correct. And to fix it we can either kludge around with `make distclean` to not delete what should be build artifacts, or move building the documentation from `bootstrap` to `make doc`.",
    "created_at": "2020-02-22T21:12:27Z",
    "issue": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/29233",
    "type": "issue_comment",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/29233#issuecomment-437104",
    "user": "https://github.com/vbraun"
}
```

<a id='comment:6'></a>Correct. And to fix it we can either kludge around with `make distclean` to not delete what should be build artifacts, or move building the documentation from `bootstrap` to `make doc`.

<a id='comment:7'></a>it's not just documentation. One possible way to use these is to generate help info **before** the build, something like: "you're on Debian, to make use of as many
Debian external packages as possible do `apt-get install ...`"

<a id='comment:8'></a>also, it's used for CI. You need to tell your CI host what to install to minimise build time, and this is OS-specific and pre-build.

archive/issue_comments_437107.json:

    "created_at": "2020-02-22T22:05:51Z",

<a id='comment:9'></a>OK, deletion should be done by `bootstrap-clean`, not `misc-clean`. My bad.

However, note that bootstrap is the correct build phase for making these files. This build phase, after all,  prepares `src` for `sdist`, the distribution for dist and for configure.

archive/issue_comments_437110.json:
```json
{
    "body": "Description changed:\n``````diff\n--- \n+++ \n@@ -2,7 +2,8 @@\n * make distclean blows away these generated files\n * subsequent make fails when building documentation\n \n-Fundamentally, I think bootstrap is just not the right place to generate documentation. You should just bootstrap the absolute minimum to run the actual build. Bootstrap is not a dump for miscellaneous build steps. The more you do the more likely you are to run into conflicts with other make targets.\n+This ticket fixes it by deleting the generated files in `bootstrap-clean` instead of `misc-clean`.\n+\n \n Comment: 1\n \n``````\n",
    "created_at": "2020-02-22T22:09:10Z",
    "issue": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/29233",
    "type": "issue_comment",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/29233#issuecomment-437110",
    "user": "https://github.com/mkoeppe"
}
```

Description changed:
``````diff
--- 
+++ 
@@ -2,7 +2,8 @@
 * make distclean blows away these generated files
 * subsequent make fails when building documentation
 
-Fundamentally, I think bootstrap is just not the right place to generate documentation. You should just bootstrap the absolute minimum to run the actual build. Bootstrap is not a dump for miscellaneous build steps. The more you do the more likely you are to run into conflicts with other make targets.
+This ticket fixes it by deleting the generated files in `bootstrap-clean` instead of `misc-clean`.
+
 
 Comment: 1
 
``````
